title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 5.

questions.question: What kind of sin is reported among the Corinthians according to 1 Corinthians 5:1?
options: Fornication involving a man's father's wife
questions.correctAnswer: Fornication involving a man's father's wife
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:1 reports that there is fornication such as is not even named among the Gentiles, specifically that one should have his father's wife.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:2, how did the Corinthians respond to the sin?
options: They were proud and did not mourn
They reported it to the elders
questions.correctAnswer: They were proud and did not mourn
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:2 states that the Corinthians were puffed up (proud) and had not mourned that the one who committed the deed might be taken away.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 5:3, Paul says he has judged the offender as if he were:
questions.correctAnswer: Present in person
questions.explanation: Paul declares in 1 Corinthians 5:3 that though he is absent in body, he is present in spirit and has judged the offender as though he were present.

questions.question: What is the purpose of delivering the sinner unto Satan according to 1 Corinthians 5:5?
options: For the destruction of the flesh so the spirit may be saved
To exile him from the city
questions.correctAnswer: For the destruction of the flesh so the spirit may be saved
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:5 explains that the sinner is delivered unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:6, what happens when a little leaven leavens the whole lump?
options: The whole group is affected by sin
questions.correctAnswer: The whole group is affected by sin
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor in 1 Corinthians 5:6 to show that a little sin (leaven) can affect the entire community (lump).

questions.question: What are the Corinthians instructed to purge out according to 1 Corinthians 5:7?
questions.correctAnswer: The old leaven
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:7 commands the Corinthians to purge out the old leaven so that they may be a new lump, symbolizing the removal of sin.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 5:8 compare to Christ being sacrificed?
options: Keeping the feast with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the feast with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:8 compares Christ as our Passover sacrificed for us, urging believers to keep the feast with sincerity and truth, not old leaven.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 5:9, Paul wrote an epistle instructing the Corinthians not to:
questions.correctAnswer: Company with fornicators
questions.explanation: Paul states in 1 Corinthians 5:9 that he wrote to them not to keep company with fornicators.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 5:10, Paul forbids the Corinthians from associating with all people in the world.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:10 clarifies that Paul does not forbid associating with all people, only not keeping company with certain sinners within the church.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:11, which of the following is NOT listed as a reason to avoid keeping company with a brother?
questions.correctAnswer: A teacher
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:11 lists fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, and extortioner, but not 'teacher' as reasons to avoid company.

questions.question: Who does Paul say should judge those inside the church according to 1 Corinthians 5:12?
questions.correctAnswer: The church members themselves
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:12 implies that the believers are responsible to judge those within the church, not those outside.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:13, who judges those outside the church?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:13 states that God judges those who are outside the church.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 5:13 instructs believers to put away from among themselves the wicked person.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:13 commands believers to remove the wicked person from among themselves.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:4, in whose name are the Corinthians gathered together?
questions.correctAnswer: Our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:4 says that when the Corinthians are gathered together, it is in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 Corinthians 5:8: 'Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavened bread of ______ and ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: sincerity and truth
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:8 instructs to keep the feast with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 5 instruct the church to handle a member who is openly living in serious sin?
options: To deliver the person unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so the spirit may be saved
To forgive immediately without any discipline
To ignore the sin to maintain peace
To publicly shame the person without hope of restoration
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver the person unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so the spirit may be saved
questions.explanation: Verse 5 teaches delivering such a one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved, emphasizing church discipline with the goal of restoration (1 Corinthians 5:5). This is supported by the call to remove the wicked person from among you (1 Corinthians 5:13) and judging those within the church (1 Corinthians 5:12).

questions.question: What warning does Paul give about boasting or glorying in 1 Corinthians 5?
options: A little leaven leavens the whole lump
Boasting is acceptable if it is about good works
Boasting is only wrong when it is about wealth
questions.correctAnswer: A little leaven leavens the whole lump
questions.explanation: Verse 6 warns that your glorying is not good because a little leaven leavens the whole lump, illustrating how tolerating sin can affect the entire church community (1 Corinthians 5:6, 7).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5, why should believers purge out the old leaven?
options: So that they may be a new lump, as they are unleavened
questions.correctAnswer: So that they may be a new lump, as they are unleavened
questions.explanation: Verse 7 instructs believers to purge out the old leaven so that they may be a new lump, as they are unleavened, symbolizing holiness and sincerity in contrast to malice and wickedness (1 Corinthians 5:7-8).

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 5:8 guide believers in their attitude during Christian fellowship and worship?
options: To keep the feast with sincerity and truth, not with malice and wickedness
To ignore personal holiness during fellowship
questions.correctAnswer: To keep the feast with sincerity and truth, not with malice and wickedness
questions.explanation: Verse 8 encourages believers to keep the feast not with old leaven or the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth, emphasizing purity in Christian gatherings (1 Corinthians 5:8).

questions.question: What does Paul say about associating with fornicators in the church according to 1 Corinthians 5?
options: Do not keep company with anyone who is called a brother and is a fornicator
Always associate with fornicators to show love
Ignore their behavior to avoid conflict
Only avoid fornicators outside the church
questions.correctAnswer: Do not keep company with anyone who is called a brother and is a fornicator
questions.explanation: Verse 11 specifically instructs not to keep company or even eat with a brother who is a fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, or extortioner, stressing church discipline and separation from sin within the body (1 Corinthians 5:11).

questions.question: Does 1 Corinthians 5 teach believers to judge those outside the church?
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains that believers are not to judge those outside the church, but to judge those within. Judgment of outsiders is God's responsibility (1 Corinthians 5:12-13).

questions.question: What is the purpose of delivering a sinful brother to Satan as taught in 1 Corinthians 5?
options: For the destruction of the flesh, so the spirit may be saved
To permanently exclude them from the church
To punish without hope of restoration
questions.correctAnswer: For the destruction of the flesh, so the spirit may be saved
questions.explanation: Verse 5 explains that delivering such an one unto Satan is for the destruction of the flesh but so that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus, highlighting restoration and salvation as the ultimate goal (1 Corinthians 5:5).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5, how should the church respond to a brother living in sin to maintain holiness?
options: Put away the wicked person from among yourselves
Pray for them but take no action
Ignore their sin to keep peace
questions.correctAnswer: Put away the wicked person from among yourselves
questions.explanation: Verse 13 commands to put away from among yourselves that wicked person, emphasizing the need for church discipline to preserve holiness and witness (1 Corinthians 5:13).

questions.question: What does Paul mean by 'a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump' in the context of 1 Corinthians 5?
options: Allowing sin in the church affects the entire community negatively
Leaven is a good symbol of growth
questions.correctAnswer: Allowing sin in the church affects the entire community negatively
questions.explanation: Verse 6 uses the leaven metaphor to warn that tolerating sin in one member can influence and corrupt the whole church community (1 Corinthians 5:6-7).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In 1 Corinthians 5, Paul compares Christ to our _____ who was sacrificed for us.
questions.correctAnswer: Passover
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states, 'For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us,' highlighting Christ as the ultimate sacrifice for sin (1 Corinthians 5:7).

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 5 guide believers in dealing with sin among those 'called brothers'?
options: Do not keep company with them and do not eat with them
questions.correctAnswer: Do not keep company with them and do not eat with them
questions.explanation: Verse 11 instructs believers not to keep company or eat with a brother who is living in known sin, emphasizing separation while maintaining the goal of repentance and restoration (1 Corinthians 5:11).

questions.question: What attitude toward sin within the church does Paul encourage in 1 Corinthians 5?
options: Mourning over sin and desiring its removal
questions.correctAnswer: Mourning over sin and desiring its removal
questions.explanation: Verse 2 criticizes the Corinthians for being puffed up instead of mourning that the sinning member might be taken away, encouraging a humble sorrow over sin (1 Corinthians 5:2-3).

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 5, Christians should avoid all association with non-believers who sin.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 10 clarifies that Paul did not forbid associating with fornicators of the world, covetous, extortioners, or idolaters outside the church, recognizing the necessity of living in the world without compromising holiness (1 Corinthians 5:9-10).

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 5, Paul says he has already judged the man committing serious sin. How does he do this despite not being physically present?
options: He judged as though present because he is present in spirit
He waited until visiting to judge
He delegated the judgment to others
He refused to judge until physically there
questions.correctAnswer: He judged as though present because he is present in spirit
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states Paul has judged already as though he were present, because he is present in spirit, showing the authority of apostolic judgment even when absent (1 Corinthians 5:3-4).

questions.question: What biblical virtue is emphasized by Paul when he instructs to keep the feast with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth?
questions.correctAnswer: Sincerity and truth in fellowship
questions.explanation: Verse 8 calls for keeping the feast with sincerity and truth, emphasizing genuine holiness and integrity in Christian life and worship (1 Corinthians 5:8).

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 5.

questions.question: What specific sexual sin is reported among the Corinthians that even Gentiles would not tolerate, according to 1 Corinthians 5:1?
options: A man having his father's wife
questions.correctAnswer: A man having his father's wife
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:1 explicitly states the fornication reported was that someone had his father's wife, a sin so scandalous it was not even named among Gentiles.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:2, how did the Corinthian church respond to the sin, and what should their response have been?
options: They were proud, but should have mourned
They ignored it, but should have rejoiced
They punished the sinner, but should have forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: They were proud, but should have mourned
questions.explanation: Verse 2 describes their pride ('puffed up') and states they should have mourned so that the sinner might be removed.

questions.question: Paul mentions acting 'absent in body, but present in spirit' when judging the sinner. What does this reveal about his apostolic authority?
options: His spiritual presence conveys authority even without physical presence
He was physically present but spiritually absent
He deferred judgment to local elders
He was unsure about how to discipline the sinner
questions.correctAnswer: His spiritual presence conveys authority even without physical presence
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:3 shows Paul’s authority transcends physical presence because his spiritual authority and the power of Christ accompany his judgment.

questions.question: What is the purpose of delivering the offender "unto Satan" mentioned in 1 Corinthians 5:5?
options: For the destruction of the flesh so that the spirit may be saved
To separate him forever from the church
To condemn him publicly among all churches
questions.correctAnswer: For the destruction of the flesh so that the spirit may be saved
questions.explanation: Verse 5 explains the disciplinary action aims at physical or moral destruction to ultimately save the offender’s spirit on the day of the Lord.

questions.question: What metaphor does Paul use in 1 Corinthians 5:6 to illustrate the danger of tolerating sin in the church?
options: A little yeast spoils the dough
A small fire burns the whole forest
A tiny seed grows into a large tree
questions.correctAnswer: Leaven affects the whole lump
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor of leaven (yeast) in verse 6 to show how a small amount of sin can corrupt the entire community.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 5:7 use the concept of "leaven" typologically in relation to Christ?
options: Christ is our Passover sacrificed to purge out old leaven
Christ is likened to yeast that multiplies
questions.correctAnswer: Christ is our Passover sacrificed to purge out old leaven
questions.explanation: Verse 7 typologically connects Christ’s sacrifice with the Passover and purging old leaven, symbolizing sin’s removal.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:8, believers are instructed to keep the feast with what kind of 'leaven'?
options: Unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
questions.explanation: Verse 8 contrasts old leaven (malice and wickedness) with the unleavened bread symbolizing sincerity and truth for believers.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 5:9-10, Paul clarifies his previous instruction about associating with fornicators. What is the distinction he makes?
options: Not to associate with believers who sin, but not necessarily with all sinners in the world
Not to associate with any sinners at all
To avoid all contact with Gentiles
To shun all people who are covetous or idolaters
questions.correctAnswer: Not to associate with believers who sin, but not necessarily with all sinners in the world
questions.explanation: Paul differentiates between avoiding sinful brothers (believers) and not avoiding all sinners outside the church (verse 9-10).

questions.question: What types of sinful behaviors does Paul list in 1 Corinthians 5:11 that disqualify a 'brother' from fellowship?
options: Fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, extortioner
questions.correctAnswer: Fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, extortioner
questions.explanation: Verse 11 lists these specific sins for which believers should not eat or keep company with such a brother.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 5:12, what is the church’s responsibility concerning judgment?
options: To judge those inside the church, not those outside
To judge both insiders and outsiders equally
questions.correctAnswer: To judge those inside the church, not those outside
questions.explanation: Paul states in verse 12 that believers should judge those inside the church but leave outsiders to God’s judgment.

questions.question: What is the final directive Paul gives regarding the wicked person among the Corinthians in 1 Corinthians 5:13?
options: Put away the wicked person from among yourselves
Forgive and restore the wicked person immediately
Ignore the wicked person and pray for them
Report the wicked person to civil authorities
questions.correctAnswer: Put away the wicked person from among yourselves
questions.explanation: Verse 13 instructs the church to remove the wicked person from their fellowship for the health of the community.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 5, Paul equates the church community to 'a lump' that can be leavened by a little sin.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:6 uses the analogy that 'a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump,' referring to the church community being affected by sin.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul referring to Christ as 'our Passover' in 1 Corinthians 5:7 in the context of the Old Testament?
options: Christ’s sacrifice fulfills and replaces the Passover lamb, symbolizing redemption
Christ is compared to the manna in the wilderness
Christ is portrayed as the High Priest of Israel
Christ is identified as the Ark of the Covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Christ’s sacrifice fulfills and replaces the Passover lamb, symbolizing redemption
questions.explanation: Paul uses typology in verse 7 connecting Christ’s sacrifice to the Passover lamb which delivered Israel, indicating fulfillment and redemption.

questions.question: How does the cultural context of Corinth in the ancient Near East amplify the scandal of the sin mentioned in 1 Corinthians 5:1?
options: Incest was taboo even among Gentiles, making the sin extremely disgraceful
Polygamy was widely accepted, so this sin was common
Corinth was known for leniency toward sexual immorality
Marrying one’s father’s wife was a cultural norm
questions.correctAnswer: Incest was taboo even among Gentiles, making the sin extremely disgraceful
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 5:1 references Gentiles not naming such sin, indicating incest was culturally abhorrent, heightening the church’s scandal.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'deliver such an one unto Satan' in 1 Corinthians 5:5 imply about early Christian views on spiritual authority and discipline?
options: It implies excommunication into the realm of evil to bring repentance and salvation
It means casting the person into literal demonic possession
It involves handing the person over to Roman authorities
It is a metaphor for forgiving and forgetting
questions.correctAnswer: It implies excommunication into the realm of evil to bring repentance and salvation
questions.explanation: Verse 5 shows discipline as placing the sinner outside church protection ('unto Satan') to yield repentance and spiritual restoration.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What specific sin is reported among the Corinthians that Paul condemns as not even named among the Gentiles?
questions.correctAnswer: One having his father's wife
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly condemns the sin of a man having his father's wife as something so egregious it is not named among the Gentiles (1 Corinthians 5:1). This is a clear violation of God's moral law (Leviticus 18:8) and reflects the seriousness of sexual immorality forbidden in Scripture.

questions.question: According to Paul, how were the Corinthians reacting to the sin committed in their midst?
options: They were puffed up and not mourning
questions.correctAnswer: They were puffed up and not mourning
questions.explanation: Paul rebukes the Corinthians because they were arrogant (puffed up) and failed to mourn over the sin, which showed a lack of proper church discipline and concern for holiness (1 Corinthians 5:2). This contrasts with biblical calls to godly sorrow (2 Corinthians 7:10).

questions.question: How does Paul describe his judgment on the offender despite being absent in body?
options: Present in spirit and having already judged
questions.correctAnswer: Present in spirit and having already judged
questions.explanation: Paul asserts that though absent physically, he is present in spirit and has already made a judgment concerning the offender, showing the authority of apostolic judgment and the spiritual unity of the church (1 Corinthians 5:3). This aligns with Christ's headship over the church (Ephesians 1:22).

questions.question: In whose name does Paul instruct the Corinthians to act when addressing the sinning member?
options: The name of our Lord Jesus Christ
The name of the Apostle Peter
questions.correctAnswer: The name of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul commands that church discipline be carried out in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, emphasizing that authority over the church is vested in Christ himself (1 Corinthians 5:4). This reflects Christ's role as head of the church (Colossians 1:18).

questions.question: What is the purpose of delivering the offender 'unto Satan' according to Paul?
options: For the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved
questions.correctAnswer: For the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved
questions.explanation: Paul explains that the disciplinary action aims at the destruction of the sinful nature ('the flesh') so that the person's spirit may ultimately be saved on the day of the Lord, showing the redemptive purpose of church discipline (1 Corinthians 5:5). This principle aligns with Proverbs 3:11-12 and Hebrews 12:6.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use to warn the Corinthians about the impact of tolerating sin in their community?
options: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump
A small fire burns a great forest
One bad apple spoils the whole barrel
A tiny seed grows into a large tree
questions.correctAnswer: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump
questions.explanation: Paul employs the metaphor of leaven (yeast) to illustrate how a small amount of sin can corrupt the whole church community, highlighting the necessity of holiness and separation from sin (1 Corinthians 5:6). This echoes Old Testament warnings about impurity affecting the whole assembly (Exodus 12:15).

questions.question: What is the spiritual significance of 'purging out the old leaven' according to Paul?
options: To become a new lump, as Christians are unleavened
To gain favor with the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: To become a new lump, as Christians are unleavened
questions.explanation: Paul calls the Corinthians to remove the old leaven (symbolic of sin) so they may be a new lump, reflecting their new identity in Christ who is their Passover sacrifice (1 Corinthians 5:7). This typology connects Christ’s atoning work to the Old Testament Passover (Exodus 12).

questions.question: How does Paul describe the proper way to keep the feast, contrasting old and new leaven?
options: Not with old leaven of malice and wickedness but with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
By inviting all people regardless of conduct
questions.correctAnswer: Not with old leaven of malice and wickedness but with unleavened bread of sincerity and truth
questions.explanation: Paul instructs the church to celebrate with sincerity and truth, not with malice and wickedness, using the metaphor of unleavened bread to signify purity in worship and conduct (1 Corinthians 5:8). This reflects the New Testament ethic of holiness (Ephesians 4:22-24).

questions.question: What instruction did Paul previously give to the Corinthians regarding associating with fornicators?
questions.correctAnswer: Not to company with fornicators
questions.explanation: Paul reminds the Corinthians that he had already instructed them in a letter not to associate with those who practice fornication, emphasizing the principle of church purity and separation from sin (1 Corinthians 5:9). This aligns with Old Testament purity laws (Deuteronomy 7:3-4).

questions.question: According to Paul, why should the Corinthians not completely avoid associating with sinners in the world?
options: Otherwise they would have to leave the world entirely
questions.correctAnswer: Otherwise they would have to leave the world entirely
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that Christians are not to avoid all sinners as that would mean leaving the world entirely, highlighting the distinction between judging within the church and engaging with the world (1 Corinthians 5:10). This supports the biblical mandate to be 'in the world but not of it' (John 17:15-16).

questions.question: What categories of sinful behavior does Paul specifically mention that a 'brother' might be guilty of, requiring separation?
options: Fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, extortioner
Lazy worker, proud man, dishonest merchant, false prophet
questions.correctAnswer: Fornicator, covetous, idolater, railer, drunkard, extortioner
questions.explanation: Paul lists specific sins including fornication, covetousness, idolatry, railing, drunkenness, and extortion among those who claim to be brothers but live in sin, instructing the church to not even eat with such persons (1 Corinthians 5:11). This reflects the biblical call to discipline unrepentant sinners (2 Thessalonians 3:6).

questions.question: What principle does Paul state regarding judging those outside the church compared to those inside?
options: Believers should judge those inside the church, God judges those outside
Believers should judge both inside and outside
No one is to judge anyone
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should judge those inside the church, God judges those outside
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that the church is responsible for judging its own members but should leave judgment of those outside the church to God (1 Corinthians 5:12-13). This maintains the purity of the church and aligns with divine justice (Romans 2:1-3).

questions.question: What action does Paul command the Corinthians to take regarding the wicked person in their midst?
options: Put away from among yourselves that wicked person
questions.correctAnswer: Put away from among yourselves that wicked person
questions.explanation: Paul commands the church to remove the wicked person from their fellowship to preserve holiness and witness, illustrating the biblical practice of excommunication for unrepentant sin (1 Corinthians 5:13). This principle is consistent with Matthew 18:15-17.

questions.question: What is the eschatological hope connected to the disciplinary action described in this chapter?
options: The spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul states that the ultimate goal of church discipline is the salvation of the offender’s spirit at the eschatological day of the Lord Jesus (1 Corinthians 5:5), linking present holiness with future judgment and redemption (Revelation 20:11-15).

questions.question: What Christological title does Paul use when explaining the metaphor of being unleavened?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ our Passover
questions.explanation: Paul refers to Christ as 'our Passover' who has been sacrificed for us, connecting Jesus’ atoning death with the Passover lamb of the Old Testament, emphasizing substitutionary atonement and deliverance from sin (1 Corinthians 5:7). This is consistent with John the Baptist's testimony (John 1:29).
